pr_title: Allow choosing which types of search suggestions to show

timeline.message:
Allow choosing which types of search suggestions to show

local, remote, both, none
Replacing the old on-off setting

timeline.bodyHTML:
I think we should do the migration process a little different. First of all, it is good to store the last used/started NewPipe version (or better version code). That should also help us when creating a welcome tour and showing changelogs in future versions, too.
Depending on the last used version, we could do something like this:

int lastStartedVersionCode = preferences.getInt(context.getString(R.string.last_started_newpipe_version_code), -1);
if (lastStartedVersionCode < 951) { // version code for 0.19.6
    // do migration here or call a method
}
// register later migrations here

The only thing we should figure out is how to differentiate between a new installation and a user updating. Both have not set last_started_newpipe_version_code, but a new installation does not need to run migrations. @wb9688 @B0pol @Stypox Any thoughts on this or suggestions for a different structure of the migration process?

We should update the last used version code if necessary at the end of

NewPipe/app/src/main/java/org/schabi/newpipe/App.java

Line 85 in 049c8f7

public void onCreate() {
